entities: Office of the UN High Commissioner for Refugees
summary:
The Security Council:
- Calls on all actors to adopt a gender perspective when negotiating and implementing peace agreements, considering special needs of women and girls, supporting local women's peace initiatives, and ensuring protection of human rights (para 8).
- Urges parties to armed conflict to respect international law applicable to women's and girls' rights and protection (para 9).
- Calls on parties to take measures to protect women and girls from gender-based violence (para 10).
- Emphasizes the responsibility of states to prosecute those responsible for crimes against women and girls (para 11).
- Calls on parties to respect the civilian and humanitarian character of refugee camps and settlements (para 12).
- Encourages consideration of different needs of female and male ex-combatants and their dependants during disarmament, demobilization, and reintegration (para 13).
- Reaffirms readiness to consider humanitarian exemptions and the impact on civilians, particularly women and girls (para 14).
- Expresses willingness to ensure Security Council missions consider gender and women's rights (para 15).
- Invites the Secretary-General to conduct a study on the impact of armed conflict on women and girls and submit a report (para 16).
- Requests the Secretary-General to include progress on gender mainstreaming in peacekeeping missions in his reporting (para 17).
- Decides to remain actively seized of the matter (para 18).
